author: AETerry
title: Strata Scooter
review:
Ah yes, I remember wanting to get all of the Space Lego sets... and my parents thinking I wouldn't be happy with that, to get me the Castle and Town themes instead. So any Space sets I got were usually of my own money or a gift from a family member.

 

This was one of the sets I found to have the Blue Space Minifig and that's largely the reason I picked this one up.

 

Some good pieces to use in either it's original model or to pull apart and put into a MOC design. A very decent little set.

author: rab1234
title: decent classic space buggy
review:
Overall Rating

This is a decent little buggy with a cool blue spaceman and a couple of interesting parts and colors to it.  It's not the greatest of classic space, but the white/black/red/green all look good with the blue spaceman.  I also like that this is a classic rover and, in my opinion, a bit better than some of the awkward walker builds.

Building Experience

Very fast build at 35 parts.  Not much in the way of interesting building techniques can be done with such a small build.

Parts

I like the trans-green dishes, a couple of unique hinges and of course the printed logo on the front of the buggy and blue spaceman.  Considering how few parts there are, I still give this a decent rating for parts.

Playability

Not much you could do with this one without investing in more sets.  Like a lot of these single minifig sets, this one gets a middle of the road rating for playability.

Value for the Money

This was one of those impulse buy items and would have been worth the money to keep a kid from throwing a tantrum and, later on, adding to a growing space collection.  Spaceship!
